Documenting recent changes and troubleshooting for titan2:
=== SSH Connectivity Troubleshooting === Initial attempts to connect to titan2 via Ansible failed with "Permission denied (publickey,password)". Investigation revealed: * Incorrect public key in `/home/will/.ssh/authorized_keys` on titan2 (it was an old root@netbox1 key). * `PubkeyAuthentication yes` and `AuthorizedKeysFile .ssh/authorized_keys` were commented out in `/etc/ssh/sshd_config`.
Action Taken: * Manually uncommented `PubkeyAuthentication yes` and `AuthorizedKeysFile .ssh/authorized_keys` in `/etc/ssh/sshd_config` via direct SSH session. * Restarted SSH service (`sudo systemctl restart ssh`). * Used Ansible `copy` module (with password-based SSH initially) to replace the content of `/home/will/.ssh/authorized_keys` with the correct `will@titan2` public key. Result: SSH connectivity was successfully established via public key authentication.
=== Autofs Client Configuration & Verification === After restoring SSH connectivity, the `autofs_client` role (now updated to include NFS configuration) was applied to titan2.
Action Taken: * Ran `ansible-playbook playbooks/configure_autofs_client.yml -i inventory.ini -e "ansible_user=will" --ask-become-pass` on titan2. * Ran `ansible-playbook playbooks/verify_autofs_client.yml -i inventory.ini -e "target_host=titan2" -e "ansible_user=will" --ask-become-pass` to verify the mounts. Result: * CIFS mount at `/mnt/smb/share` successfully verified. * NFS mount at `/mnt/nfs/will` successfully verified.
titan2 is now fully configured with autofs for both SMB and NFS shares.
